Answer: To communicate between two Android devices over WiFi, you can use the WiFi Direct API. WiFi Direct allows you to establish a peer-to-peer connection between two devices. Here is a basic example of how you can use it:

<<<api>>>: WiFiManager
<<<code>>>: 
```java
WifiManager wifiManager = (WifiManager) getSystemService(Context.WIFI_SERVICE);
WifiDirectManager wifiDirectManager = (WifiDirectManager) getSystemService(Context.WIFI_DIRECT_SERVICE);

if (wifiDirectManager.isWifiDirectSupported()) {
    WifiDirectChannel channel = wifiDirectManager.createWifiDirectChannel();
    channel.setWifiDirectCallback(new WifiDirectCallback() {
        @Override
        public void onPeersChanged() {
            super.onPeersChanged();
            // Called when the list of peers has changed
        }

        @Override
        public void onChannelDisconnected() {
            super.onChannelDisconnected();
            // Called when the channel has been disconnected
        }
    });
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: First, you need to get the WiFiManager and WifiDirectManager services. Then, you can check if WiFi Direct is supported on the device. If it is, you can create a WiFi Direct channel. You can then set a callback to be notified when the list of peers has changed or when the channel has been disconnected.

To send data, you can use a DataOutputStream. Here is an example:

```java
DataOutputStream dataOutputStream = new DataOutputStream(channel.getOutputStream());
dataOutputStream.write("Hello from App A!".getBytes());
dataOutputStream.flush();
```

This will send the string "Hello from App A!" to the other device. The other device will then be able to read this data using a DataInputStream:

```java
DataInputStream dataInputStream = new DataInputStream(channel.getInputStream());
String message = dataInputStream.readUTF();
```

Please note that this is a basic example and you may need to handle exceptions and edge cases in a real-world application. Also, you need to request the necessary permissions to use the WiFi Direct API.
